thread.title: Lenovo launches two new budget smartphones in India
thread.title_full: Lenovo launches two new budget smartphones in India

author: Deccan
title: Lenovo launches two new budget smartphones in India
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 21, 2015, 19.47 pm The Lenovo Vibe P1 (left) and the P1m (right) Mumbai: Lenovo on Wednesday launched two new 4G handsets—Vibe P1 and P1m—priced at Rs 15,999 and Rs 7,999, respectively and both the devices are based on Android 5.1 Lollipop operating system.
"These handsets showcase our focus on offering consumers the best of battery life along with other high-end features as well," Lenovo India Director Smartphones Sudhin Mathur said.
The P1 features 5.5-inch display, 1.5 Ghz octa-core processor, 2GB RAM, 32 GB memory (expandable up to 128GB), 13MP rear and 5MP front camera and 4,900 mAh battery.
The most striking feature of the P1 is its 4,900-mAh battery, which is enough to keep the device running for more than a day seamlessly.
On the other hand, the P1m features a 5-inch display, 1Ghz quad-core processor, 2GB RAM, 16 GB memory (expandable up to 32GB), 8MP rear and 5MP front camera and 3,900 mAh battery.
Currently, both smartphones are listed on Flipkart, but you’ll have to wait a bit longer to purchase the P1. On the other hand, the P1m will be up for sale Flipkart’s website exclusively on October 28. The ones who are interested in buying the device should quickly register for the Lenovo VIBE P1m sale before October 27.
